transportAdvice: Belize City is compact but not particularly walkable for tourists due to safety concerns in certain areas, so taxis are the recommended way to get around; taxis are widely available and typically use fixed zone-based fares rather than meters. Public buses connect the city to other towns and districts, but tourist areas are generally better served by taxis or organized transfers.

weather.description: January is one of the driest and most pleasant months, with warm days and cooler evenings making it ideal for outdoor activities.
February remains dry and sunny with comfortable temperatures, considered one of the best months to visit.
March is warm and largely dry with increasing sunshine, excellent conditions for reef and jungle exploration.
April brings hotter temperatures and very little rain, making it a popular time for beach and diving trips.
May marks the beginning of the rainy season with occasional afternoon showers, though mornings are often clear.
June sees frequent rainfall and high humidity as the wet season intensifies, with lush green landscapes as a result.
July is wet and humid with regular heavy showers, though brief dry spells still allow for outdoor activities.
August remains firmly in the rainy season with high humidity and the possibility of tropical storm activity.
September is the peak of hurricane season and one of the wettest months, with travelers advised to monitor weather closely.
October continues to see significant rainfall and elevated storm risk, though hurricane activity begins to taper off.
November transitions toward the dry season with decreasing rainfall, though humidity remains noticeable.
December is generally dry and pleasant with cooler breezes, making it a popular month for visitors seeking comfortable weather.
